text: The 2017–18 season is Plymouth Argyle's first season back in League One since the 2010–11 season, following their promotion from League Two and their 132nd year in existence. Along with competing in League One, the club will also participate in the FA Cup, EFL Cup and EFL Trophy. style="background:#0C4934; color:#FFFFFF; width:150px;"| Name ! style="background:#0C4934; color:#FFFFFF; width:150px;"| To ! style="background:#0C4934; color:#FFFFFF; width:120px;"| End date ! style="background:#0C4934; color:#FFFFFF; width:50px;"| Ref. |- | 2 September 2017 || CB || || Jordan Bentley || Sutton United || 1 October 2017 || |- | 27 October 2017 || CB || || Callum Rose || Dorchester Town || 30 June 2018 || |- | 4 January 2018 || CF || || Alex Fletcher || Torquay United || 1 February 2018 || |- | 15 January 2018 || CF || || Nathan Blissett || Macclesfield || 30 June 2018 || |- | 30 January 2018 || LW || || Gregg Wylde || Morecambe || 30 June 2018 || |} ==Competitions== ===Friendlies=== On 5 May 2017, Plymouth Argyle announced Cardiff City will visit during the pre-season schedule. A week later, it was confirmed the club will visit the Netherlands again this summer playing two friendlies whilst abroad while other friendlies were also announced in England. Two more friendlies were revealed on 25 May 2017. ===League One=== ====League table==== ====Result summary==== ====Results by matchday==== ====Matches==== ===FA Cup=== On 16 October 2017, Plymouth Argyle were drawn at home against Grimsby Town in the first round. A second round away trip to Bradford City was confirmed. ===EFL Cup=== On 16 June 2017, Plymouth Argyle were drawn away to Bristol City in the first round. ===EFL Trophy=== On 12 July 2017, Plymouth were drawn against Chelsea U23s, Exeter City and Yeovil Town in Southern Group D. ==References== Plymouth Argyle Category:Plymouth Argyle F.C. seasons
